attributes.action: Stop the Iraqi Teenager get £2,000,000 of Compensation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A teenager in Iraq was accidentally shot by a British troop and could receive up to £2,000,000 in compensation. This is totally unjustifiable!! The teenager knows their home is a war zone so should expect at least a few casualties. 
Their injury is superficial, a bullet hole will heal in time yet our troops who have sustained significantly worse injuries (lost legs from mines) are getting their disability benefits removed and their disabled parking badges revoked. How the government sees this to be just I will never know.
This country is becoming a shambles with all its priorities lost, sort it out!!!
This partition is just a start; there are so many things this government needs to sort out now!!
£2,000,000 can buy 14,000 suits of body armor to protect BRITISH troops. Don’t spend it on one teenager!!!

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
Statements that don't actually request any action
